title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
A few months ago, I decided to apply for Google Summer of Code, hoping to contribute to an open-source project that would challenge me and make a real impact. After weeks of anticipationâ€¦
Iâ€™m thrilled to announce that Iâ€™ve been selected as a Google Summer of Code 2025 contributor! ðŸš€

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
The Project
Iâ€™ll be working on developing a Hamiltonian Library for QuTiP â€“ a project thatâ€™s both technically exciting and practically valuable. For those unfamiliar, QuTiP is the Quantum Toolbox in Python, a leading framework that researchers use to simulate quantum systems.

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
What Iâ€™ll Be Working On
Hereâ€™s the problem Iâ€™m helping to solve: currently, QuTiP users often need to recreate common quantum system Hamiltonians from scratch, leading to duplicated effort and potential inconsistencies. My project aims to change that by creating a comprehensive library of ready-to-use implementations.
The project will include:

Ready-to-use quantum system models (Jaynes-Cummings, Rabi, Dicke, and various spin-chain models)
Standardized APIs for consistency across different quantum models
JSON serialization for cross-platform compatibility
Time-dependent parameter support for dynamic quantum systems
LaTeX representation for clear mathematical documentation

This will essentially provide researchers with a well-tested, standardized toolkit for quantum simulations, reducing redundant work and improving consistency across the field.

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
Looking Forward
Iâ€™m genuinely excited about this opportunity. The selection process was competitive, and Iâ€™m grateful to have been chosen to work on something that will directly benefit the quantum computing research community.
When I first submitted my application, I knew it was a long shot â€“ but Iâ€™m glad I took the chance. Now I get to spend the summer contributing to open-source software that actual researchers will use in their work.

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
Whatâ€™s Coming Next
Over the next few months, Iâ€™ll be: - Developing and testing the core Hamiltonian library components - Learning deeper aspects of quantum mechanics and numerical methods - Contributing to a project that will be used by researchers worldwide - Documenting the entire development process

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
Acknowledgments
I want to thank the QuTiP community and NumFOCUS for this incredible opportunity. The mentorship and support theyâ€™ve already provided has been exceptional, and Iâ€™m looking forward to working closely with them throughout the summer.

title: Exciting News: Iâ€™m Joining Google Summer of Code 2025!
text:
Follow the Journey
Iâ€™ll be sharing updates about my progress right here on this blog. You can expect: - Technical insights about quantum computing and library development - Challenges and solutions encountered during the project - Code examples and implementation details - Reflections on contributing to open-source scientific software
This summer promises to be an exciting blend of learning, coding, and contributing to the quantum computing community. Stay tuned!

If youâ€™re interested in quantum computing, open-source development, or just want to follow along with my GSoC journey, feel free to connect. And if youâ€™re a fellow GSoC participant this year, Iâ€™d love to hear about your projects too!

title: About
text:
Current Work
Google Summer of Code 2025 Contributor
May 2025 - Present
Working with NumFOCUS on developing a Hamiltonian Library for QuTiP (Quantum Toolbox in Python). The project aims to create a standardized, comprehensive library of quantum system Hamiltonians to reduce redundant work in the quantum computing research community.
Key contributions: - Developing ready-to-use implementations of common quantum systems - Creating standardized APIs for consistency across different models - Implementing JSON serialization for cross-platform compatibility - Adding LaTeX representation capabilities for clear documentation
